description: Hurricane Milton is barreling toward storm-battered Florida as the 2024 presidential candidates respond to the looming natural disaster. CBS News national correspondent Manuel Bojorquez has more on the storm from Orlando. Then, CBS News' Scott MacFarlane and Jake Rosen join to discuss the latest in the 2024 race.
title: Hurricanes Milton and Helene loom over final weeks of 2024 race

description: "The Office" actress Jenna Fischer on Tuesday revealed that she was diagnosed with breast cancer last year but is now cancer-free after receiving treatment.
title: "The Office" star Jenna Fischer reveals breast cancer diagnosis, treatment

description: Afghan national Nasir Ahmad Tawhedi was charged with planning a terrorist attack in the U.S. on Election Day.
title: Afghan national arrested for plotting ISIS-related Election Day terrorist attack

description: Rep. Chuck Edwards debunked some of misleading information spread by former President Donald Trump and others.
title: North Carolina Republican pushes back on hurricane misinformation

description: The number of Americans moving to high-risk areas from low- and moderate-risk areas has doubled after the pandemic.
title: Americans are flocking to U.S. regions most threatened by climate change

description: Hurricane Milton's approach has Disney World readying to close its doors along with other theme parks across Florida.
title: Disney World joins theme park closures ahead of Hurricane Milton

description: A family man abruptly vanishes. Police tie his disappearance to a monstrous plot for revenge. "48 Hours" correspondent Natalie Morales reports Saturday, Oct. 12  at 9/8c on CBS and streaming on Paramount+.
title: Sneak peek: Who Took Our Dad? The Abduction of Ray Wright

description: Hurricane Milton is scrapping hundreds of U.S. flights and forcing cruise ships to take evasive action.
title: Hurricane Milton snarls travel by air, land and sea. Here's what to know.

description: President Biden announced more than $2 billion in funding to replace all lead pipes in the U.S. CBS News' Scott MacFarlane has the latest.
title: Biden announces plan to remove lead pipes nationwide

description: Tina Harris says Dr. James Ryan said he would eat at the restaurant her daughter Sarah worked at so she would be his server, long before they met. Years later, when Sarah was an adult, she had her wisdom teeth removed by him, began working for him, and became his girlfriend, all before Ryan was charged with her murder.
title: Woman says doctor noticed her daughter years before they began dating

description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis spoke to reporters Tuesday ahead of Hurricane Milton's landfall, which is expected Wednesday evening. DeSantis said the current models show the storm is expected to hit south of Tampa, Florida, but more will be known in the next 12 to 18 hours. The governor also warned residents about the dangerous storm surge along the state's west coast.
title: Florida Gov. DeSantis warns of Hurricane Milton storm surge along entire west coast

description: A former Houston police officer was sentenced to 60 years in prison for the murder of a married couple during a raid that revealed corruption in the narcotics unit.
title: Retired Houston officer gets 60 years for deaths of couple during drug raid

description: In late August, Judge Alexandre de Moraes ordered that X be suspended in Brazil after owner Elon Musk refused to name a legal representative in Brazil.
title: Brazil's Supreme Court lifts ban on social media site X

description: Hurricanes Milton and Helene are likely to bring out scammers eager to exploit people's impulse to help those in need. Here's how to avoid getting ripped off.
title: Hurricane fraud is on the rise, feds warn. Beware these scams.

description: Hurricane Milton was barreling across the Gulf of Mexico as a powerful Category 4 storm on a path headed toward Tampa, Florida.
title: Milton on path for Florida landfall as potentially historic major hurricane

description: Damage left behind by Helene could become another dangerous obstacle for Floridians hunkering down for Hurricane Milton. CBS News' Cristian Benavides has more from St. Petersburg, and Tom Hanson speaks to DeSoto County's Sondra Guffey about shelter preparations.
title: Helene debris could become projectiles in Hurricane Milton's path

description: The late Lisa Marie Presley and her daughter, Riley Keough, give a raw look inside their famous family's lives at Graceland and beyond in a new memoir.
title: Read an excerpt of Lisa Marie Presley's memoir, "From Here to the Great Unknown"

description: A New York Times/Siena College poll finds Vice President Kamala Harris is standing out more among voters than former President Donald Trump for representing change. CBS News' Robert Costa has more as the campaigns reach the final stage.
title: New poll on Harris, Trump representing change

description: Florida braces for Hurricane Milton; Boeing, workers' union back at negotiation table for 2nd day
title: 10/8: CBS News 24/7 Episode 2

description: State Department spokesperson Matthew Miller weighed in on reports that the Iran-backed Hezbollah militant group is seeking a cease-fire deal with Israel. Miller took questions on when the U.S. wants a diplomatic solution installed to end the conflict in the Middle East.
title: State Department on Hezbollah wanting cease-fire

description: Gold can be a smart addition to your portfolio in most economic climates, but there are big reasons to buy in now.
title: 4 signs you should invest in gold now

description: 14 attorneys general allege in several lawsuits filed against TikTok that the social media app is harming children's mental health and relies on "addictive features." Massachusetts Attorney General Andrea Campbell broke down the commonwealth's allegations Tuesday.
title: TikTok relies on addictive features, lawsuits claim

description: As Hurricane Milton barrels toward Florida, many are preparing their homes and evacuating before devastating winds and potential flooding slam the state. Meteorologist Jessica Burch has the latest forecast, and CBS News' Manuel Bojorquez reports from Orlando.
title: Hurricane Milton's immense size forces more evacuations

description: Independent Dan Osborn is running a surprisingly competitive Senate race in deep-red Nebraska in his bid to unseat two-term Sen. Deb Fischer.
title: Nebraska Senate race surprise: It's "more competitive than it should be"

description: Tampa Mayor Jane Castor warned that Hurricane Milton's storm surge will likely exceed what was recorded for Hurricane Helene. Castor also says there is no shortage of gasoline at this time in the area.
title: Tampa officials on Hurricane Milton storm surge, access to gas

description: On Tuesday, Oprah Winfrey announced "From Here to the Great Unknown" is her latest book club selection.
title: Riley Keough on emotional journey completing Lisa Marie Presley's memoir

description: If you spot any of these red flags during the debt forgiveness process, you may want to reevaluate your approach.
title: 7 credit card debt forgiveness red flags to watch for

description: Still, Vice President Kamala Harris "The View" co-hosts that "not a thing" comes to mind that she would do differently than President Biden.
title: Kamala Harris proposes Medicare pay for more in-home health care

description: President Biden is warning that Hurricane Milton could be the worst storm to hit Florida in over a century. CBS News Bay Area meteorologist Jessica Burch forecasts Milton will make landfall as a Category 3 storm near Tampa, where CBS News' Tom Hanson has more on preparations.
title: Hurricane Milton is matter of life and death, Biden warns

description: Milton evacuees are facing congested roads and gas stations running out of fuel as the hurricane approaches.
title: Florida gas stations in these cities face fuel shortages amid Milton evacuations

description: The Supreme Court on Tuesday takes up a controversial gun rights case involving what are known as ghost guns. They have no serial number and their owners build them out of parts that are hard to trace. One family reflects on their son's recovery three years after he was shot, allegedly with a ghost gun.
title: Family reflects on ghost gun shooting as Supreme Court takes up controversial case

description: Hezbollah rockets hit Haifa as the militant group's acting leader vows to continue striking Israel, the Associated Press reports. This comes as more Israeli troops enter Lebanon. CBS News' Chris Livesay has the latest from Tel Aviv.
title: Hezbollah, Israel ramp up attacks, rockets hit Haifa

description: Debt forgiveness can offer relief from your credit card debt, but there are limitations to this type of relief.
title: Can I get all of my credit card debt forgiven?

description: The Justices at the U.S. Supreme Court are hearing oral arguments Tuesday on a major challenge to a Biden administration regulation to restrict so-called ghost guns. Some gun advocates say the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives overstepped when it narrowed the definition of what's considered a firearm. CBS News legal contributor Jessica Levinson provided context about the case.
title: Supreme Court hears challenge to ghost gun regulation

description: North Carolina is changing some of its voting rules to make sure no one is denied the right to vote as some areas remain inaccessible. CBS News' Skyler Henry is in North Carolina where the race is razor thin and voter turnout is critical.
title: North Carolina amends some voting rules so Helene survivors can still cast ballots

description: President Biden has canceled his trip to Germany and Africa as Hurricane Milton threatens the west coast of Florida with catastrophic storm surges and winds. CBS News has the latest on the Category 4 storm.
title: Latest news as Hurricane Milton targets Florida

description: The airline is dropping the temperature on food served to economy-class passengers on all transatlantic flights.
title: JetBlue drops hot meals from menu for coach passengers on transatlantic flights

description: A $20,000 HELOC comes with inexpensive monthly payments that could become even cheaper in the short term.
title: Here's what a $20,000 HELOC costs monthly now that rates were cut

description: Sondra Guffey, economic development director for Florida's DeSoto County, joined CBS News to talk about how residents in the non-coastal parts of Florida are getting ready for Hurricane Milton.
title: Local Florida official on potential inland impacts from Hurricane Milton

description: Former President Donald Trump has falsely claimed several times that FEMA is diverting funds away from Republicans and favoring Democrats. FEMA has been fighting back against those claims while Vice President Kamala Harris called Trump "incredibly irresponsible" for making them. Attorney and CBS News campaign reporter Katrina Kaufman has more.
title: Trump campaign peddling false claims about FEMA allocations

description: The next president will have to manage a delicate situation as the threat of an all-out war escalates.
title: Harris and Trump's positions on Iran and Israel as tensions flare

description: A long-term CD offers savers unique benefits if opened this month. Here's what to know now.
title: Why a long-term CD is better than a short-term one this October

description: TikTok is facing a lawsuit from attorneys general from 13 states and Washington, D.C., who say the app both harms the mental health of young users and relies on "addictive features" to keep users on the platform. CBS News senior business and technology correspondent Jo Ling Kent has more.
title: 14 attorneys general sue TikTok, say app exploits young users and promotes addictive use

description: Effective on Dec. 31, Cynt Marshall will retire as CEO and will remain a consultant of the organization through December 2025.
title: Dallas Mavericks CEO Cynt Marshall announces retirement

description: Major retailers are offering early deals for your holiday shopping, even before Halloween arrives. Consumers are expected to spend more than $240 billion online this holiday season, which is up 8% from last year. CBS News' Nancy Chen breaks down the bargains you can find at places like Amazon, Target and Walmart+.
title: Early deals for holiday shopping

description: Riley Keough and Oprah Winfrey wear gloves as they reveal never-been-touched belongings inside Elvis Presley's "black box" that he'd travel with.
title: Oprah Winfrey wowed by personal items found inside Elvis Presley's "black box"

description: Vice President Kamala Harris is calling former President Donald Trump extraordinarily irresponsible spreading misinformation about the federal response to Hurricane Helene. CBS News campaign reporter Aaron Navarro has more.
title: Harris calls out Trump for spreading misinformation about federal response to hurricanes

description: Places like Fort Myers, Florida, could see anywhere from 10 to 15 feet of storm surge depending on Hurricane Milton's path. It's a community still rebuilding from Hurricane Ian, which hit in 2022. On Monday, many braved the rain to stock up on sandbags to prepare their homes and businesses.
title: Floridians prepare for Hurricane Milton's dangerous storm surge

description: At least nine counties in Florida are under mandatory evacuation orders as Hurricane Milton closes in on its Gulf Coast. Milton on Monday became the strongest storm in the Gulf of Mexico since 2005. Forecasters say it could be the worst storm in western Florida in more than a century.
title: Hurricane Milton prompts mandatory evacuations in parts of Florida as its barrels toward coast

description: A look at key moments since Hamas terrorists stormed into Israel, sparking a war that, a year later, threatens to ignite the Middle East.
title: Israel and Hamas at war: A timeline of major events since Oct. 7, 2023

description: The traditional holiday shopping period between Thanksgiving and Christmas is almost one week shorter this year.
title: Holiday creep starts even earlier this year, with shorter selling window

description: The Weather Channel's Stephanie Abrams has the latest forecast for Hurricane Milton after the storm intensified Monday from a Category 2 to a Category 5 hurricane.
title: Hurricane Milton on path to Florida as it explodes in strength

description: Hurricane Milton strengthened into a monster storm, leading to dire warnings and mass evacuations in Florida. Also, Vice President Kamala Harris sits down for a wide-ranging interview with 60 Minutes. All that and all that matters in today's Eye Opener.
title: Eye Opener: Hurricane Milton strengthens into monster storm at near-record speed

description: Fort Myers Beach, Florida, is under a mandatory evacuation order ahead of Hurricane Milton's expected landfall. The mayor of the community, Dan Allers, joined CBS News to discuss the storm and CBS News New York meteorologist John Elliott has a look at the forecast.
title: Florida mayor on preparations and evacuations ahead of Hurricane Milton

description: The rule issued by the Biden administration in 2022 seeks to subject unserialized ghost funs to the same requirements as commercially made firearms.
title: Supreme Court to hear arguments in challenge to ATF's ghost gun rule

description: A court in Germany has acquitted Christian Brueckner, the only suspect in the disappearance of Maddie McCann, on unrelated rape and sexual abuse charges.
title: Only suspect in Maddie McCann case acquitted of unrelated rape charges

description: No decision has been made about bringing the bodies down from the mountain, which would require extensive manpower and equipment.
title: 5 climbers fall to their deaths on the world's 7th-highest peak

description: On "60 Minutes: A Second Look," hear what it was about former first daughter Alice Roosevelt that captivated America.
title: Washington's princess: How Alice Roosevelt captivated America

description: The EPA estimates that nine million homes in the U.S. have lead pipes.
title: Biden to announce $2.6B in funding to replace all lead pipes throughout the U.S.

description: Living in extended-stay hotels, often a last resort for low-income families trying to avoid homelessness, can lead to or exacerbate various children's physical and mental health issues, advocates say.
title: How living in extended-stay hotels can affect the health of poor kids

description: Limited access to Gaza since the Israel-Hamas war started makes it hard to analyze the destruction, but satellite data paints a grim picture.
title: Data helps map destruction in Gaza since Israel-Hamas war began

description: CIA Director William Burns warned Monday of the potential for simmering clashes in the Middle East​ to spread across the region.
title: CIA director warns "misjudgments" could further escalate Middle East conflict
